title: When will they bring back the REVIVE?!
body:
It seems like riot is starting to just create one-direction play to the league and completely abandoning the diversity part of the game.

While CLAIRVOYANCE AND CLARITY STILL EXISTS, REVIVE GOT REMOVED.

I know most people in **lower elo** tends to use it for trolling but **they wouldve trolled no matter what** and they STILL DO!

I was a big revive/tp user and I am very disappointed that Riot finally decided to put the final nail down on diversity.

Revive was already nerfed once and it was fine the way it was. It was x-factor that people could still use and I was one of the users.

Will riot ever bring back revive?

Seems like Riot really wants to abandon diversity part of the game where people can get caught by surprise and turn the game around as well.

WTF RITO. Plz...

Am I the only one who actually clicked on the image and noticed almost all of those scores with Karthus are pretty damn bad for a Karthus..? o.o

pure score tells in some cases but with revive tp, it really is not that bad of a score either. You get involved a shit ton more with shit ton more dmg. 
on top of 60% wining ratio, I always had highest damage on either team by a landslide.

KDA doesn´t do anything for winning games, taking objectives is what counts - and a good karthus doesn´t hesitate to go in, deal enough dmg to peel them of from an objective and trade himself for a solid lead everytime the opportunity arises.

Actually, KDA on Karthus is very important. Unlike many non-tanky champs, he has a HUGE team fight presence and even if he's not getting kills, he's getting assists with his ult, with his E, or simply just pressing W. Karthus is a high-presence mage who is known for ending games with an amazing KDA due to the fact that he is going to hit everyone on the enemy team and secure at least an assist off of it. To say 'KDA doesn't do anything for winning games' is silly. Your KDA does show your skill. If you're 0/12/3 on Janna or Soraka, you can say 'Oh, I'm a support, I don't have a good KDA'. No. You do, because it's KILL, DEATH, ASSISTS. You press a heal on one person, you bubble an AoE tank, you'll get the assists you need, just like Karthus pressing W and dying in the middle of an enemy team or even just pressing R, he WILL get the assists when played right.
Participating is important. But kda stats does not reflect the players skills. Especially on revive tp

I think the problem wasn't trolling - it didn't really so much "open your competitive options" as "lessen the punishment you take when you screw up." And since it cost you a summoner...
You probably could have used flash instead of revive and just *lived* most of the times you would have used it. Karthus is pretty much the only champion this makes even a little sense on. And if we're talking about summoners that were only good on one champion - Surge was pretty good an plenty of champions. (Especially Cho. More big.)

while this makes a good argument, there are times when revive outweighs flash. 
In terms of just pure 5v5 all in damage output, revive does so much more damage than flash. While flash can be used to maybe get in more better position to zonya or something like that, revive gives you full hp with crazy movement speed with tp.
Flash on Karthus lets you do what Fiddledicks likes to do. Jump into the middle of the team and AoE the every living crap out of them.
Yeah i wish for revive back not gonna lie.
WE NEED IT BACK

Honestly I believe they removed revive because of Ekko. Given how long it takes to create champions (months to years) they probably thought Ekko would make it into the game eventually and saw a good opportunity to remove a factor that would imbalance him beyond any reasonable fixes.
lol I remember those days.
{{champion:245}}
When he dies, his Chronobreak clone disappears (as he already used Chronobreak to not "die" in his death animation), problem solved.
We need the zombie {{champion:266}} back revive, passive, guardian angel, and then full tank.

To be fair, there weren't a ton of uses for Revive.

Despite that, the times people found uses for them like Revive-Teleport Karthus was great and the thing is that it actually worked extremely well, was crazy fun, and it even made it into Ranked Games.

Riot most likely removed Revive because people used it to troll/feed. But honestly Flash, Teleport, and Smite were probably used more as troll spells than Revive so I believe in that logic, those three spells should of been removed before this one was.

Even if spells like Clarity, Clairvoyance, Cleanse, etc are still largely unused, I still find uses for them and they work really well on some champions and even then at the very least, you can still use it in Normal games.

There wasn't a ton use for revive but there certainly were people who used it very greatly and had great time with. 

I'm just weirded out that riot removed some of unused spells over revive which actually had better impact than some of the other ones.
Think of it as a "why keep something if .00000000001% of player base uses it"? It doesn't make sense to keep it because 12 people who play the game use it (fake statistics of course).
Over my years playing league I ran across maybe 20 people using {{summoner:2}} . Yet it still exists....

I'm going to advocate that Revive, at its very core, promoted a negative outlook- you might not think it directly, but it's instinctive to the spell. When you take Revive, you assume you're going to die. Granted yes, it probably will happen- but if you only die twice that's a summoner you only used... twice- in the entire game. 

It's the only summoner with an explicit condition that requires either good enemy play or bad personal/team play to be useful- TP can always be used somewhere because minions/towers, flash can always be used, ignite will be usable because it just requires being near-ish the enemy, &c &c- there's no outstanding play for them to be useful, just conditions that are constantly being met.

In addition, there's no time when Revive actually _gives_ you something (except _maybe_ the speed boost with Hecarim, but that's VERY specific)- every other spell _gives_ something for you to work with; Revive simply cushions what the enemy _gets_. Revive just lowers the damage to your tower, your death time, and your lost CS- while TP gives cross-map movement/play potential in addition to 2/3 of the things revive gives; Flash gives an instant in/out card; Ghost gives engage potential  from longer distance and through minion waves; &c &c.

actually, with the revive/teleport combo, it could turn the game in your favor easily, especially early game.  a tactic I used sometimes was to all in against bot lane while my support survives, reduce them to 30%, wait for them to chase my support hoping to kill him/her, then revive/teleport when they've overextended and kill them both instantly for a revenge gold lead.  works like a charm if your opponents aren't careful, especially if your support wards the bushes

However, it's the only summoner that requires you to _give_ something to the enemy- they get gold for you to have a chance to use your summoner. Yeah, it _may_ result in a lead, but it's less so than if you get a double kill off of regular summoner's usage because the gold lead you get is partially offset by the gold they got. And it immediately resets your bounty and gets you 1 kill away from a spree while giving the enemy more gold to work with- and thus higher chances to swing it to their favor.

Revive indeed lacks in terms of how it can be used but on certain champions such as karthus, hecarim and even nasus or even aatrox, revive was used as a 6v5 method or a method to bait a fight which often in late game, leads to victories
Rito doesn't like diversity in their game
If something is almost never used except in troll tactics, it's probably not something that should exist.
